reviews.review_msg: He is very kind and humorous, but it is just so much HW!!! And it is either proving or coding+report writing. (I'm not a math major and don't know if this is typical for upper level math classes) Grading is very tough, too. I learned a lot in this class, in a painful way.
DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!! The professor cannot explain the concept and the content clearly. You have to learn most of the things outside of class.
What you need to write for homework basically has nothing to do with what is taught in class. The grading was very very very very strict. unbelievably strict.

Although the homework was assigned, it often didn't align with the materials covered in class, making it difficult to apply the concepts learned. Additionally, there was an expectation to utilize Python; however, the class lacked sufficient guidance on the language, leaving many students feeling unprepared to complete the assignments.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

His class is extremely way more difficult than other professors. Amath352 should not be included with coding skills, but he is the only professor to ask students to do so. Although it doesn't have midterm or final, the difficulty of his homework is way higher than it should be. Also, he seldom replied emails for students.

The class is based only on homework grades, but the professor doesn't go over a huge portion of the content that is required for the hw. The course content also does Not align with what was taught in the past couple years for the same exact course, and we're required to do proofs and research style papers in an applied math course???

Compared the hw to those from other professors. None of them are related and the hw given contains problems that others haven't heard about from 352. The HWs are essentially mini research paper and we have to learn a good amount of the content by ourselves from outside resources. HW is graded inconsistently between students.

The entire class is homework-based, but Professor Hosseini seems to assume students are smarter and more adaptable than they actually are. He frequently glances over core concepts and lacks to explain them thoroughly. During office hours, he is condescending and rude, and I only found solace with the TA. If you have the option, AVOID HIS CLASSES.
